channel.title: Comments for Collidoscope Berlin
channel.description: See Berlin through a lens of migration and difference

item.title: Comment on Women Only: The Frauenraum by Tania
item.dc:creator: Tania

item.title: Comment on Women Only: The Frauenraum by collidoscopeks
item.dc:creator: collidoscopeks
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://collidoscopeberlin.local/2016/05/31/the-frauenraum/#comment-68512">Julia</a>.
Hi Julia! You can help without speaking German. Volunteer-planner.org has an English site and you can find lots of opportunities there (or check out the Give Something Back to Berlin Frauenraum project). Good luck and happy volunteering! - Sophia
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Julia.

Hi Julia! You can help without speaking German. Volunteer-planner.org has an English site and you can find lots of opportunities there (or check out the Give Something Back to Berlin Frauenraum project). Good luck and happy volunteering! – Sophia

item.title: Comment on Women Only: The Frauenraum by Julia
item.dc:creator: Julia
item.description: Hi! I would love to get involved with voluntering at the Frauenraum. Is it still possible to help if I can't speak German?
item.content:encoded: Hi! I would love to get involved with voluntering at the Frauenraum. Is it still possible to help if I can’t speak German?

item.title: Comment on Refugees Welcome: Local Interventions for an EU Dilemma by Liz
item.dc:creator: Liz
item.description:
Hi Kelly,
Great article. I'm moving to NRW soon and I'm wondering if you have any contacts in the Detmold area who work with asylum seekers/refugees? Can you pls email details if you have some? Thank you for this.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Kelly,

Great article. I’m moving to NRW soon and I’m wondering if you have any contacts in the Detmold area who work with asylum seekers/refugees? Can you pls email details if you have some?
Thank you for this.

item.title: Comment on Interview: “I’m a Human Being” by Tania
item.dc:creator: Tania
item.description: Love this highly interesting, well written story, thank you, danke!
item.content:encoded: Love this highly interesting, well written story, thank you, danke!

item.title: Comment on Lens: Four Hours at Lageso by Max
item.dc:creator: Max
item.description: gorgeous, witty, captivating writing, soph! i wish investment in organizational structure would be an established part of starting grassroots do-good efforts like this.
item.content:encoded: gorgeous, witty, captivating writing, soph! i wish investment in organizational structure would be an established part of starting grassroots do-good efforts like this.

item.title: Comment on Moralpolitik and the Ressentiments of Change by Max S.
item.dc:creator: Max S.
item.description: lovely piece, kells. makes me think of my experience in garmisch-partenkirchen - further evidence of a belief i'll hold no matter how naive the news makes it out to be, that individuals sharing space, kindness and access can resolve problems even of this magnitude.
item.content:encoded: lovely piece, kells. makes me think of my experience in garmisch-partenkirchen – further evidence of a belief i’ll hold no matter how naive the news makes it out to be, that individuals sharing space, kindness and access can resolve problems even of this magnitude.

item.title: Comment on Refugees Welcome: Local Interventions for an EU Dilemma by Paris Lensky
item.dc:creator: Paris Lensky
item.description:
Hallo Kelly!
I recently arrived in Berlin, two weeks ago to shoot a documentary on the Refugee Crisis from Australia. I found this article really helpful in detailing the plans of volunteers, links to their websites and the overview of the whole situation. Thank you for writing this!
Paris
item.content:encoded:
Hallo Kelly!

I recently arrived in Berlin, two weeks ago to shoot a documentary on the Refugee Crisis from Australia. I found this article really helpful in detailing the plans of volunteers, links to their websites and the overview of the whole situation. Thank you for writing this!

Paris

item.description: So you don't read the famous Berlin Familienfunk? nice regards
item.content:encoded:

nice regards
